newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Sri Lanka refinery restarts at 60-percent Feb 25.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka refinery restarts at 60-percent Feb 25.

text.p: Sri Lanka's state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corp (CPC) is running the country's only refinery at 60-percent after it restarted in the last 24 hours from a scheduled turnaround, a company official said on Tuesday.
As reported on Monday, the 60,000 barrels-per-day refinery has completed maintenance. The company official said operations would be back to normal within a few weeks after the January 15 shutdown.
